home.text: I work mainly with React, Vue.js, Next.js, and TypeScript, and Iâ€™m currently expanding my skills in backend development with Spring Boot and MySQL. My goal is to build clean, efficient, and visually engaging digital experiences.

questions: Tell me a little about yourself
What technologies do you use in your projects?
Which project has been the most interesting for you?
How do you usually work in a team?
What are your strengths as a developer?
answers: Iâ€™m strong focus on building clean, responsive, and user-friendly interfaces. I enjoy working with React, TypeScript, and modern tools like Zustand and custom hooks to create flexible, reusable components. And always pay attention to structure and clarity â€” I like when both users and developers can easily understand the product.

Most of my projects are built with React + TypeScript, where I focus on clean component design and state management using Zustand and React Hooks. For API communication, I use Axios and structured service layers to keep the logic consistent. I also apply React-Hook-Form for flexible form control and validation. On the backend side, Iâ€™ve been exploring Spring Boot and MySQL, learning how APIs and databases connect together.

The most interesting project for me was Morago â€” a real-time translation and call platform for interpreters and clients. It combined everything I enjoy: user interface design, API integration, and WebRTC for live calls. I handled the frontend part â€” building dashboards, managing state with Zustand, and connecting to backend APIs. It was the project where learned how real-time data, authentication, and UI flow all come together in one system.

In team projects, I focus on clear communication and organized Git workflow. Usually work through feature branches, frequent commits, and pull requests to keep the codebase clean. I also like using tools like Notion or Trello to track progress and make sure everyone is on the same page. I believe consistency and respect for othersâ€™ code is the key to good teamwork.

Iâ€™d say my strengths are attention to detail, structured thinking, and adaptability.
- Always try to make my code clear, reusable, and easy to maintain.
- Quickly adapt to new technologies and enjoy learning by doing â€” for me, every project is a chance to improve.
- Also focus on UI/UX â€” making interfaces that feel natural for users.
